noun.description: A person made weak or disabled by illness or injury.

verb.description: Remove (someone) from active service in the armed forces because of injury or illness.
examples: he was badly wounded and invalided out of the infantry

adjective.description: (of an official document or procedure) not legally recognized and therefore void because contravening a regulation or law.
examples: the vote was declared invalid due to a technicality

origin: Mid 16th century (earlier than valid): from Latin invalidus, from in- not + validus strong (see valid).
